question:
The writer Lillian Hellman honestly called her disingenuous argumentative strategy “the nobility racket”: a ________ that involved taking the moral high ground no matter how removed from the subject at hand.
Blank (i)
A. philosophy
B. sophistry
C. sinecure
D. volubility
E. serendipity
